content.raw:
Can you:

* cache the list of callbacks (this can, and probably should be, a lazy cache so that if we turn the analysis submission into a plugin, we don't have to resolve plugin instantiation order dependencies! So populate a list the first time it runs through your current code and then use that list of callbacks after that)  
* Rename the callback to something more descriptive (I'm having a hard time coming up with something nice, but maybe `analysis_cancel_send`? I would probably also recommend that the local variable `analysis_filter` is renamed to `send_to_analysis` and has it's logic inverted to match the new name. This just makes the code slightly quicker to understand for people who will look at it in the future.
content.html:
Can you:

  • cache the list of callbacks (this can, and probably should be, a lazy cache so that if we turn the analysis submission into a plugin, we don't have to resolve plugin instantiation order dependencies! So populate a list the first time it runs through your current code and then use that list of callbacks after that)
  • Rename the callback to something more descriptive (I'm having a hard time coming up with something nice, but maybe analysis_cancel_send? I would probably also recommend that the local variable analysis_filter is renamed to send_to_analysis and has it's logic inverted to match the new name. This just makes the code slightly quicker to understand for people who will look at it in the future.
